name: N'-[(2E)-4,6-diphenyl-2H-thiopyran-2-ylidene]-N,N-dimethylbenzene-1,4-diamine
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2787
Reason: The basic unit for N',N-dimethylbenzene-1,4-diamine is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 °C. The presence of two phenyl groups adds significant mass and induces strong dipole moments due to their electronegativity, which can increase the melting point due to stronger intermolecular forces (each phenyl group approximately +60 °C). The thiopyran-2-ylidene group is polar and can form hydrogen bonds, thus also increasing the melting point (approximately +40 °C). The presence of two non-equivalent functional groups (phenyl and thiopyran-2-ylidene) in the para position relative to each other may slightly reduce symmetry and possibly decrease the overall effect on melting point slightly when compared to a more symmetrically substituted molecule.
